posts.cooked:
I would love to see Signal implement design elements of iOS 26 Liquid Glas.
It could show the „new message“ bubble at the bottom right corner and a wider bubble for chats, calls and stories at the bottom left of the screen.
What do you think?

I know it was announced just yesterday and that this might be a bit early. Just wanted to start a discussion.

Signal should adopt the new APIs in general.

I think spotlight search etc. also would be great, also the new camera design…

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: New APIs is harder but I would like. Liquid glass on the other hand, as far as it seemed at WWDC, should just be a recompile with Xcode 26 (or more if you add it everywhere, aka extra buttons, backgrounds, top bar…) but still doesn’t seem extremely difficult

As for WhatsApp, Liquid Glass implementation is currently in beta:

https://x.com/WABetaInfo/status/1963740134135701902

Article on the website:

WABetaInfo – 4 Sep 25

WhatsApp beta for iOS 25.24.10.70: what's new? | WABetaInfo

The WhatsApp beta for iOS 25.24.10.70 update from TestFlight uncovers the Apple's new Liquid Glass design language for the iOS 26 app.

Estimated reading time: 4 minutes

Alternative light mode style in action:

https://x.com/WABetaInfo/status/1963765557934641515

link_counts.title: WhatsApp beta for iOS 25.24.10.70: what's new? | WABetaInfo

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: The devs already had some commits implementing it. Won’t be released until iOS 26 is though, as apps compiled with xcode26 cannot be released on the official app store, only TestFlight.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.77 release iOS Beta Feedback
Unfortunately, we don’t plan to have day-one support. iOS 26 produced way more UI issues with existing components than we expected, and it’s taking us some time to get it production-ready. It’s coming, though!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.77 release

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.86 release iOS Beta Feedback
Today, we’re releasing version 7.86 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group. This release includes two notable changes: a Liquid Glass redesign, and group polls! Release notes: Signal polls are here! Are you and your friends on the same page, or are you poll-ar opposites? Polls are an easy way to see what your group chat really thinks. Create a poll with competing dinner options, vacation destinations, musical preferences for an upcoming road trip, or any other i…
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.86 release

Liquid Glass

This is the first version of our Liquid Glass redesign, available to users on iOS 26. We’ve improved several parts of our app with a fresh coat of paint, new animations, and a lot of Liquid Glass. Give it a shot: play around with chat wallpapers, the now-dynamic message input bar, a refreshed attachment picker, and much more!

Notably, we have not yet applied the new styling to every screen in the app: for example, our calling UI, the media viewer, navigation/tabs on iPad, and in-chat banners. We plan to continue improvements in future releases!

We’re excited to finally share these features with you all, and we look forward to your feedback!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.86 release

posts.cooked:
It looks amazing! Thank you!

In the next iterations could you bring down the search bar and compose icon? In line with the OS design? It is also easier since it’s closer to our fingers. Thanks.
You should post this to the beta thread, so the devs are more likely to see and implement it.

Notably, we have not yet applied the new styling to every screen in the app: for example, our calling UI, the media viewer, navigation/tabs on iPad, and in-chat banners. We plan to continue improvements in future releases!

We’re excited to finally share these features with you all, and we look forward to your feedback!
